comment: Explains basic concepts in convoluted ways, almost in a way that artificially inflates the difficulty of 2211. Lectures, HW, and breakouts are non representative of test material. Test averages are in the 50s, which he believes is the fault of his students. I learned more about calc-based physics from watching OChem Tutor than this course.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: His rate my professor reviews do not reflect him at all. He is a GREAT professor and very smart. You will learn a lot from him. He makes his in person classes and breakout sessions to where he makes sure everyone is understanding fully. He gives a very good grasp of conceptual physics too which helps in Thermo and Fluid.

Ive compared his lecture slides to a different teacher, and his presentations are actually insane. Either understand it in class on the spot or teach yourself on youtube before lecture, only right way to actually get something out of class. Lowkey he also be straight up yelling at students when asking questions, it came off condescending at times.

He's a chill guy if you talk to him personally just make sure your at the lectures and make sure you get a full understanding of the concepts. He is a tough grader so make sure you don't make simple mistakes. Talk to him about the grade you recive.

GPA thrower. Tests are worth 60%of your final grade and 3 questions long. Class averages for tests are abnormally low compared to other teachers of this course. You leave his lectures just as informed about the subject as when you first walked in. Homework would have helped if it was similar to his tests. Beware of taking his class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: If you dont know the material before taking the course, dont take it.  He automatically assumes you know everything by each lecture. Goes over the concepts lightly in lecture and then exams are nothing like homework or breakout sessions. I think he is a great person, but if you take his class, keep a bottle of baby oil in your backpack, youll need.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Calculus based physics is a hard class by itself, but this professor makes this class much harder. There are no thorough examples used in class, and the homework questions do not reflect the test questions. There are 3 questions on his tests. I dropped after the 2nd test. Class averages were a 67% on the first and 64% on the second. Beware.

His lectures and breakout sessions do not look anything like the stuff on exams. 
He gets mad at us for asking questions, which demotivates our ability to learn. Just because something seems like common sense to him does not mean it is common sense to us. He judges people by their past, even when they change, which is very unprofessional.

Tests are all free response, but they're poorly written and require an OUTRAGEOUS level of scenario-to-math application. Every time I had a question about something, his answers came with condescending rhetoric and public berating. Required attendance, but spends class-time "preparing" us for future classes without prepping us for his.

Terrible professor. Preaches about how we learn from doing practice problems and then never did them in class. I had to learn most of this class from my tutor and even then, the test questions were way harder than anything on homework. Also says he doesn't do curves but put 50 points of extra credit on the final. Class averages on tests were 50s.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Sich truly knows physics and expects you to know it to the degree that he does. Very hard to dictate what will be on tests when lectures are theory based. Success for tests is to just know the full aspect of topics and not so much math. Most questions don't involve numbers and instead are variables. know calc 1 and he goes into Diff Equation a bit

This dude ruined my GPA.I studied so hard for his class.I was hopping that he tests over the lecture that he gives us,BUT he just tests over things that he never talks about. He literally MAKES YOU HATE PHYSICS.If you are in engineering field, DON'T TAKE HIM.If you like your mental health and the GPA that you are working hard on DON'T TAKE HIM.

Sich definitely knows what he's talking about and cares about student success. He also grades tests very graciously, so I doubt many people would fail this course. Attendance is mandatory as there's a one-question quiz every class. He uses so many words to say so little and it gets very confusing, but in the end you can figure it out. Probably.

If you are not an engineering student you won't pass the class. He doesn't teach anything that's on the tests in class, it's all in recitation, and if you don't go all three days of the week you will be clueless. There is no point in going to lecture, besides the quizzes which he uses for attendance, so you can get a 50 for just showing up to class

If you are looking for a lab professor who won't make you feel stupid for asking questions, please don't take him. He WILL call you out in front of the class if you don't submit a report properly or ask a question that seems common knowledge. He makes the labs very confusing and I'm only on lab 3 this semester. Find another professor :).

Took calculus based physics PHYS 2211 with him. If you are actively participating in class and make an attempt to try and understand, he will pass you. He emphasizes the setup and theoretical portion of physics problems. Tests are graded in more-so of how to set up the problem. Plenty of partial credit is given out on tests for setting up questions
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Sich seems like a caring teacher in the beginning, encouraging you to participate in class. Then he seems to find more and more joy in humiliating you. At the last class before I dropped, he got angry at us for asking pertinent questions. His powerpoints have no flow of information. I'd give him a 0 if I could. He's only here for his own ego.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: One question quizzes every class on concept questions on D2L all semester. You get a 50 if you get it all wrong. 75 if you get the answer right but explain wrong, and 100 if you get the answer and explain right. Tests are 3 questions and 1 bonus question. Tests are grading heavily on you understanding the concept and not so much math
The lab of this class is very easy, with just 11 assignments for the whole year and they're graded easily.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: People complained about him using lectures to explain the theory of physics, which was extremely helpful to me. If you don't understand the formulas' story, they're hard to grasp. In recitation, he actually works through the formulas. He offers almost all day any day for office hours and slows down his explanation until you get it. Physics is hard
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Nice person, not a good teacher for this course. This is because his lectures are all about the theory of physics, while his tests are 3 questions and require understanding the math part of physics. Also, attendance is not mandatory, but he gives a quiz almost every class, and homework like 1-2 times a week. A very sucky class for sure.

Google "Sich v. Franciscan Univ. of Steubenville" & "Sich Scales Back Chernobyl Findings". He was also fired from an APS high school because parents complained about him so much. I was one of those parents. He is a complete narcissist and blames his students for his inability to teach was also my experience with him as another student mentioned.

Dr. Sich's lectures and recitations were useless. To make a good grade, you have to commit to teaching yourself the material. Although attendance was not mandatory, quizzes were given at nearly every lecture. He is knowledgeable, but I feel that I learned nothing from his class. 3 tests, harshly graded, all calculations (no MC), expecting an A/B.

This man straight up RUINED my semester. He is a complete narcissist and blames his students for his inability to teach. Don't get me wrong, the man is brilliant, but he definitely doesn't belong in a classroom. I ended up needing to withdraw from his class after failing the first 2 exams. You will also have a quiz before every class so study hard!

I have ALWAYS made straight A's at KSU, but had a 20 in the class before add drop, ended up dropping the class. When asking for help reviewing a homework problem, he told me that myself and other women are not qualified for his class because apparently knowing the exact way a piston functions is common knowledge. Literally changed my major bc him
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Sich was a great lab instructor and such an easy grader. Only graded on lab reports, which were tear out pages of pre-purchased lab manual. Great choice for physics lab. However, he showed us one of his lecture exams, and it seemed incredibly tough. Don't know if I would recommend for lecture.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I had him for lab but a different prof for lecture so sometimes his lab would be ahead of lecture. However, he did his best of explaining things and will always try to help if you ask him a question. Nice guy too. I suck at physics but as long as you follow instructions you'll be fine!

(only had for lecture, not lab) He is knowledgeable, but he spends too much time on topics in lecture he admits are not relevant to the course. The homework takes days, not 1-2 hours as he claims, the tests are 3 questions, and they're nothing like the homework problems or problems done in class. Recitation quizzes are the only thing I got an A on.
I took him for my physics lab and he was a great professor. Attend labs and he is always willing to help. Grades all lab reports very easily.
